member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinValue
member.summary: Defines the GPIO Pin values 0 for low, 1 for High.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinResistorPullMode
member.summary: The GPIO pin resistor mode. This is used on input pins so that their lines are not floating.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinResistorPullMode.Off
member.summary: Pull resistor not active. Line floating

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinResistorPullMode.PullDown
member.summary: Pull resistor sets a default value of 0 on no-connects

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinResistorPullMode.PullUp
member.summary: Pull resistor sets a default value of 1 on no-connects

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinDriveMode
member.summary: Defines the different drive modes of a GPIO pin.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinDriveMode.PwmOutput
member.summary: PWM output mode (only certain pins support this -- 2 of them at the moment)

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinDriveMode.GpioClock
member.summary: GPIO Clock output mode (only a pin supports this at this time)

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ThreadLockKey
member.summary: Defines the different threading locking keys.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.EdgeDetection
member.summary: Defines the different edge detection modes for pin interrupts.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.BoardRevision
member.summary: The hardware revision of the board.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.BoardRevision.Rev1
member.summary: Revision 1 (the early Model A and B's).

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.BoardRevision.Rev2
member.summary: Revision 2 (everything else - it covers the B, B+ and CM).

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.BcmPin
member.summary: Defines all the BCM Pin numbers available for the user.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.P1
member.summary: Enumerates the different pins on the P1 Header. Enumeration values correspond to the physical pin number.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.P1.Pin03
member.summary: Header P1 Physical Pin 3. GPIO 0 for rev1 or GPIO 2 for rev2.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.P1.Pin05
member.summary: Header P1 Physical Pin 5. GPIO 1 for rev1 or GPIO 3 for rev2.

member.name: F:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.P1.Pin13
member.summary: Header P1 Physical Pin 13. GPIO 21 for rev1 or GPIO 27 for rev2.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.P5
member.summary: Enumerates the different pins on the P5 Header as commonly referenced by Raspberry Pi documentation. Enumeration values correspond to the physical pin number.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioController
member.summary: Interface for Raspberry Pi GPIO controller.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioController.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the with the specified BCM pin.
member.returns: A reference to the GPIO pin.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioController.Item(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.BcmPin)
member.summary: Gets the with the specified BCM pin.
member.returns: A reference to the GPIO pin.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioController.Item(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.P1)
member.summary: Gets the with the specified pin number.
member.param: The pin number in header P1.
member.returns: A reference to the GPIO pin.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioController.Item(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.P5)
member.summary: Gets the with the specified pin number.
member.param: The pin number in header P5.
member.returns: A reference to the GPIO pin.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin
member.summary: Interface for GPIO Pin on a RaspberryPi board.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.BcmPinNumber
member.summary: Gets the BCM chip (hardware) pin number.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.Header
member.summary: Gets the pin's header (physical board) location.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.PinMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the pin operating mode.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.InputPullMode
member.summary: This sets or gets the pull-up or pull-down resistor mode on the pin, which should be set as an input. Unlike the Arduino, the BCM2835 has both pull-up an down internal resistors. The parameter pud should be; PUD_OFF, (no pull up/down), PUD_DOWN (pull to ground) or PUD_UP (pull to 3.3v) The internal pull up/down resistors have a value of approximately 50KΩ on the Raspberry Pi.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is value.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.Read
member.summary: Reads the digital value on the pin as a boolean value.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.Write(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the specified bit value. This method performs a digital write.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.Write(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.GpioPinValue)
member.summary: Writes the specified pin value. This method performs a digital write.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.RegisterInterruptCallback(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.EdgeDetection,System.Action)
member.summary: Registers the interrupt callback on the pin. Pin mode has to be set to Input.
member.param: The callback function. This function is called whenever the interrupt occurs.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.RemoveInterruptCallback(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.EdgeDetection,System.Action)
member.summary: Removes the registered interrupt callback on the pin.
member.param: The callback function. This function is called whenever the interrupt occurs.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.RegisterInterruptCallback(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.EdgeDetection,System.Action{System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32})
member.summary: Registers the interrupt callback on the pin. Pin mode has to be set to Input.
member.param: The callback function. This function is called whenever the interrupt occurs. The function is passed the GPIO, the current level, and the current tick (The number of microseconds since boot).

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IGpioPin.RemoveInterruptCallback(Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.EdgeDetection,System.Action{System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt32})
member.summary: Removes the registered interrupt callback on the pin.
member.param: The callback function. This function is called whenever the interrupt occurs.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CBus
member.summary: Interfaces the I2c bus on the Raspberry Pi.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CBus.Devices
member.summary: Gets the registered devices as a read only collection.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CBus.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the with the specified device identifier.
member.returns: A reference to an I2C device.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CBus.AddDevice(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a device to the bus by its Id. If the device is already registered it simply returns the existing device.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice
member.summary: Interfaces a device on the I2C Bus.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.FileDescriptor
member.summary: Gets the standard POSIX file descriptor.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.Read
member.summary: Reads a byte from the specified file descriptor.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.Read(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a buffer of the specified length, one byte at a time.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.Write(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte of data the specified file descriptor.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes a set of bytes to the specified file descriptor.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.WriteAddressByte(System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary: These write an 8 or 16-bit data value into the device register indicated.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.WriteAddressWord(System.Int32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: These write an 8 or 16-bit data value into the device register indicated.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.ReadAddressByte(System.Int32)
member.summary: These read an 8 or 16-bit value from the device register indicated.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.II2CDevice.ReadAddressWord(System.Int32)
member.summary: These read an 8 or 16-bit value from the device register indicated.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiBus
member.summary: Interfaces a SPI Bus containing the 2 SPI channels.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiBus.Channel0Frequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the channel 0 frequency in Hz.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiBus.Channel1Frequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the channel 1 frequency in Hz.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiBus.Channel0
member.summary: Gets the SPI bus on channel 0.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiBus.Channel1
member.summary: Gets the SPI bus on channel 1.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiChannel
member.summary: Interfaces a SPI buses on the GPIO.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiChannel.FileDescriptor
member.summary: Gets the standard initialization file descriptor. anything negative means error.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiChannel.SendReceive(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends data and simultaneously receives the data in the return buffer.
member.returns: The read bytes from the ring-style bus.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ISpiChannel.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes the specified buffer the the underlying FileDescriptor. Do not use this method if you expect data back. This method is efficient if used in a fire-and-forget scenario like sending data over to those long RGB LED strips.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IThreading
member.summary: Interface to represent threading methods using interop.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IThreading.StartThread(System.Action)
member.summary: Starts a new thread of execution which runs concurrently with your main program.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IThreading.StartThreadEx(System.Action{System.UIntPtr},System.UIntPtr)
member.summary: Starts a new thread of execution which runs concurrently with your main program.
member.param: A pointer to the user data.
member.returns: A pointer to the new thread.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.IThreading.StopThreadEx(System.UIntPtr)
member.summary: Stops the thread pointed at by handle.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ITiming
member.summary: Interface for timing methods using interop.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ITiming.Milliseconds
member.summary: This returns a number representing the number of milliseconds since system boot.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ITiming.Microseconds
member.summary: This returns a number representing the number of microseconds since system boot.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ITiming.SleepMilliseconds(System.UInt32)
member.summary: This causes program execution to pause for at least how long milliseconds. Due to the multi-tasking nature of Linux it could be longer. Note that the maximum delay is an unsigned 32-bit integer or approximately 49 days.
member.param: The number of milliseconds to sleep.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.ITiming.SleepMicroseconds(System.UInt32)
member.summary: This causes program execution to pause for at least how long microseconds. Due to the multi-tasking nature of Linux it could be longer. Note that the maximum delay is an unsigned 32-bit integer microseconds or approximately 71 minutes. Delays under 100 microseconds are timed using a hard-coded loop continually polling the system time, Delays over 100 microseconds are done using the system nanosleep() function – You may need to consider the implications of very short delays on the overall performance of the system, especially if using threads.
member.param: The number of microseconds to sleep.

member.name: T:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.Native.HardwareException
member.summary: Represents a low-level exception, typically thrown when return codes from a low-level operation is non-zero or in some cases when it is less than zero.

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.Native.HardwareException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.Native.HardwareException.ExtendedMessage
member.summary: Gets the extended message (could be null).

member.name: M:Unosquare.RaspberryIO.Abstractions.Native.HardwareException.Throw(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Throws a new instance of a hardware error by retrieving the last error number (errno).
member.exception: When an error thrown by an API call occurs.
